intro: Kefersteinia tinschertiana, commonly known as the Tinschertian rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the high mountain regions of Central Asia. It is a small, perennial herb that typically grows in rocky and alpine environments. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
